alert.note: Alert for Alamosa; Rio Grande; Saguache (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Snow Squall Warning issued December 08 at 3:01PM MST until December 08 at 3:30PM MST by NWS Pueblo
info.description: The National Weather Service in Pueblo has issued a * Snow Squall Warning for... Northwestern Alamosa County in southeastern Colorado... East central Rio Grande County in south central Colorado... Southeastern Saguache County in central Colorado... * Until 330 PM MST. * At 300 PM MST, a dangerous snow squall was located along a line extending from near Center to 6 miles west of Hooper to 6 miles southwest of Mosca, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Intense bursts of heavy snow. Gusty winds leading to blowing snow and rapidly falling visibility. Wind gusts up to 35 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Travel will become difficult and potentially dangerous within minutes. Highway 17 between Moffat and Alamosa. Locations impacted include... Center, Hooper, and Mosca. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Slow Down! Rapid changes in visibility and road conditions are expected with this dangerous snow squall. Be alert for sudden whiteout conditions. SNOW SQUALL...RADAR INDICATED
